CABINET.Reports by Local Governments on the Political Situation in India. I circulate for the information of my colleagues the latest weekly reports from theLocal Governments in India. S. H. INDIA OFFICE, O 8th November 1932.Government of India. There has been no increase in civil disobedience activities. In the SelectCommittee on the Ordinance Bill, the Government agreed that its duration should befor three years, and an amendment limiting it to six months was defeated by thecasting vote of the Chairman. The opposition were also strongly opposed to theinclusion of peaceful picketing, but this clause was passed without material change.The opposition then proposed the addition of an explanation which had the effect ofnullifying the substantive clause, and, on this being ruled out of order, four membersleft the Committee. The Bill as now amended by the Select Committee containsmany minor changes, but has not been materially weakened.Delhi. There is nothing special to report. Section 3: arrests 1; total detained, 4.Section 4 : Fresh orders, nil. Total to date in respect of whom orders are in force, 42 ;.convictions to date for contravening orders, 10.Bombay. The districts are very quiet. Miss Whateley and Mr. Leonard Matters visitedKaira, Surat and Panch Mahals districts. Eighteen picketers have been arrested in bombay city. Foreign cloth merchants who have returned to the Mulji Jetha marketare threatened with intensive picketing if .they attempt to do business. Ordinance 10.Section 3 : arrests, 9; total under detention, 73. Section 4: orders, 9 ; total inforce, 997. Section 17 : convictions, G.Bengal. There is practically no civil disobedience activity. Section 3 : arrests, 8.Section 4 : orders issued, 22 ; in force, 628, excluding Burdwan and Dacca Divisions ;convictions, 35.Madras. A slight revival of civil disobedience activity, picketing and boycotting is reported from a few districts, mainly on account of Dipavali festival. Otherwise the situation^remains quiet and unchanged.Central Provinces. Everything is quiet. Prosecutions 5, convictions 5.United Provinces. Some no-rent agitation continues in certain districts, but otherwise nothing ofimportance has occurred. Section 3 of the Special Powers Ordinance was not used.Seven orders under section 4 have been issued and three convictions have been madefor defiance of orders tinder that section. Convictions during the week underOrdiuance, 20 ; under ordinary law, 28 ; total, 4S ; grand total up to date, 12,288total of releases and apologies, 3,014.1-10G 60 11.32 Punjab. The Province continues to be undisturbed. Political arrests, 7, all under ordinary law. Other figures remain unchanged.North-West Frontier Province. Section 3 : arrests, nil ; total detained, 2. Section 4 : orders, S ; total orders inforce, 58. The situation is normal throughout the Province.Bihar and Orissa. There is nothing to report. Five orders under Special Powers Ordinance are stillin force. Number of convictions up to 29th October, 10,741. The report from onedistrict has not yet been received.Assam. There is nothing of interest to report.Ajmer Merwara. A slight recrudescence of activity in connection with the civil disobedience movement has occurred in Ajmer. Seven arrests have been made during the week.From the Resident, Mysore, Three arrests have been made in Coorg during the week. The situation remains.unchanged. The report from Bangalore is the same as last week.
